item.title: Tools vs Data Structures
item.author: andreffs18@gmail.com (André Silva)
item.description: Usually, when interviewing for an engineering or software position, you end up doing some sort of “coding challenge”. A friend of mine has recently left the company and is doing one at the moment. He asked me for help on solving a particular challenge, which I felt was a good exercise for me. This blog post talks a bit about the challenge and my approach to solving it. Also, this post works as a personal reminder that sometimes it is not about picking the best tool, but the right data structure.

item.title: Docker + PostgreSQL
item.author: andreffs18@gmail.com (André Silva)
item.description: More often than not, I end up going online to look up on how to use docker as the middle man on interacting with Postgres. Usually for me its Postgres, but this “recipe” can be applied to any piece of software that has more than one version which you don’t have installed on your laptop. Because of this whole back and forth I compiled a small list of “how-tos” to help me remember.
